body: I think it's a good idea for donations. I may contribute too, but have no free time
If there was a way to donate, I would for sure.
@w4nderlust so can you open github donations for this repo?
@theodor38 Thanks for raising this. Rest assured, we are actively working on Ludwig. We have been busy with conference (travel)s and internal deadlines.
@msaisumanth I want to contribute this repo, do you have any roadmap about this repo.

@pingsutw Yes, we welcome contributions from everyone. But we currently don't have a public agenda. I will provide an update on it after a team discussion.

In the meantime, please take a look at the [open issues](https://github.com/uber/ludwig/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Aupdated-desc+label%3A%22help+wanted%22), [enhancements](https://github.com/uber/ludwig/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Aenhancement) and see if anything interests you. Also, you're welcome to propose new ideas too!
@msaisumanth Thanks for the reply, I will find some work in open issues first. I'm glad to heard any update about this repo after your discussion

Dear @theodor38 ,

thank you very much for this post and for your kind words. It may be difficult to perceive, but working on an open source project like this can be overwhelming, and most of the communications we receive are about errors or bugs to be solved, words of appreciation like yours are rare, but very much appreciated and help substantially in keeping us motivated!

Be sure that Ludwig is not going anywhere and we are really much commited to work on it and improve it. The recent slow down in terms of commits is due, as @msaisumanth already explained, to an alignment of deadlines and travels (I've personally attended more than 6 conferences in 4 different conferences in the second half of this year). At the same time, we are working a lot behind the scenes on a major change in the preprocessing which will make it possible to train Ludwig models on many more different data formats, and in particular to train on datasets beyond memory / disk size. As this change is not a small incremental change, but a quite substantial change, it doesn't make a lot of sense to release pieces of it, we prefer to release the finalized change, so the maount of work that is going into it is not entirely visible to the community.

Finally, we have big plans for 2020, this change in the preprocessing is the first of a number of improvements that you will see, which will include porting to TensorFlow 2 which will enable much more pre-trained model and flexibility in adding new models. we are also going to support hyperparameter optimization, something we are also working on behind the scenes. Any help from the community will be more than welcome, and it will probably have to start from us to begin with, with sharing our plans to open up development even more.

I'd like to thank @ifokeev too for proposing donations. We deeply appreciate it, but there is no need for it as it would not change our development process. We will reorganize our work in early 2020 to be able to spend more time on Ludwig than we have been able to the last couple months of 2019.

Thank you again for your continued support.
- Piero

@w4nderlust @msaisumanth 

Thank you much for the update. I wish you a great new year and best of luck with continued development with Ludwig.

In time I will try to contribute as well as I get better myself technically speaking. 

Kind regards 
Memo
